name: clinging
content:
clinging adjective
(person)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A clinging person stays close to and depends on a person who is taking care of them: Up to the time she started school, her daughter was very clinging. A very clinging and demanding elderly parent presents a problem.
More examplesFewer examplesMaria was not a clinging mother.Her clinging boyfriend got upset when she left him.Maybe you are too eager for love - too quick to be affectionate, too clinging.

clinging adjective
(clothes)
Clinging clothes fit closely to the body so that the shape of your body can be seen: She looked stunning in a clinging black dress. Mr Darcy dived into a lake and emerged in a wet, clinging shirt.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was wearing a clinging leopard skin dress.He wore very tight black trousers and a clinging white shirt.The gown was a clinging black affair created by the Italian designer Versace.
